children.value: The password in Hummingbot encrypts sensitive data such as API keys, secret keys, and wallet private keys. For security reasons, the password is only stored locally in encrypted form, and we do not have access to it.

If you are using Hummingbot for the first time, the system will prompt you to create a password. There are no character requirements, although we recommend using a strong password for additional security.
button on the welcome screen or you can press
Passwords are stored locally in your computer. No passwords are uploaded to any server.
Passwords and private keys are saved as encrypted files in
To reset your password, delete all files starting with

<Callout
  type="warning"
  body="This will disconnect your API keys from Hummingbot. You will have to re-connect your API keys."
